ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about art history and the history of French literature between 1789 and 1914 in Paris.
French art history

A broad understanding of Parisian art history from 1780-1914. We talked about the artists and writers themselves, the movements that emerged throughout the century, and the governmental structures and institutions that enabled and controlled the production of art (salons, critics, art dealers, museums, etc.).
A very deep and specific knowledge of the 18,19,20th centuries in Paris. Both artistically and historically and politically

Good overview of artists and writers that were active in Paris - a mix of art history and literature. I strengthened my French writing skills through the 3 essays, and presentation skills through the expos.
Literary and artistic history of 19th century Paris

learned about a wide array of writers and artists that lived in Paris, learned about different art movements and the impact of socio/political changes on the creation of art
developed French writing skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: you get two drafts to write each essay except for the final

Weaknesses: sometimes feedback can be a bit unclear
organised, enriching material
It's really brilliant. I wouldn't change anything

Strengths: Madame Girard has so much knowledge of French art and literature in the 18-20th centuries. I appreciated the rewrite opportunities for the essays, which allowed me to actually think deeply about how I can improve my writing. The readings were well selected and Madame Girard was very responsive to student questions. Weakness: sometimes the student presentations take up too much time, when I would've appreciated a more structured lecture from the professor.
It did not make particular sense in terms of logical progression

w: the readings didn't always seem necessary and it felt like students stopped reading as the semester went on
s: LOVED that we got to turn in version 1 of our essays, receive feedback, and then do the final version

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is a great survey class for anyone looking to learn more about the period and expand their cultural knowledge.
Yes!
I would, but I don't think it's being offered again :(
Yes. It's just a fascinating topic for anyone who's interested in Europe, France and Art History

Yes, but if you're not fully fluent in French, the readings, essays, and all-French lecture might be a little intimidating. But this is a great opportunity to improve your French writing skills and to learn about French artists and writers from a super knowledgeable professor!
Yes if you are interested in the time period and want a deep dive into certain artists.
its a fun course! not the most engaging at times but i liked the freedom to decide what to write about for the papers
